author: John Woodrow Cox
title: U.S. should conduct open investigation of Afghan airstrike
text:
This photograph released by Medecins Sans Frontieres on Oct. 7 shows medical personnel as they treat patients in a hospital in Kunduz, Afghanistan, in the aftermath of an airstrike. (MSF/Agence France-Presse via Getty Images) October 13 at 5:14 PM Regarding the Oct. 11 front-page article “ U.S. airstrike on hospital still unexplained ”:
The United States should conduct an open investigation, similar to the U.S. Navy investigation of the sinking of a Japanese training ship for high schoolers by the USS Greeneville in 2001 . While such an investigation would fall short of the international investigation that Doctors Without Borders is calling for, it would provide much-needed transparency while allowing the U.S. military to control access to, or release of, classified information.
Paul Durand , Potomac
